campaign.story:
Tens of thousands already use Luna Display for Mac and now we’re bringing that same magic to Windows. Whether you’re working remotely, looking to maximize your workspace, or seeking more creative flexibility - Luna has you covered. As the only hardware solution on the market, you can...
Turn any iPad into a wireless second display for your PC or Mac
Connect via WiFi or USB 
Experience lag-free lightning-fast speeds
Use any Windows or Mac app
Utilize full touch support and external keyboard support 
Choose from two unit options for PC: USB-C or HDMI

More people than ever are working from home due to the COVID-19 pandemic. We're a fully-remote company ourselves — and have been since we started 7 years ago — so we truly understand the struggles of working remotely. That’s why we built Luna Display!
Life is better when your workflow works— 
Not enough screen space to work efficiently? Luna acts as a second display, so you can extend your workspace from your desktop to iPad.
Traditional monitors leave you tethered to your desk. But Luna works wirelessly over your existing WiFi network — so you can move your workspace around your house, to the office, and everywhere in between. 
Mobile second screen setups are often complex to set up and require lots of wires and tools. With Luna, you can pair a Windows or Mac computer to an iPad with just some apps and your Luna. No need to buy new screens - make the most out of what you have.




Luna works with any Mac or Windows desktop application —  

Luna gives you the flexibility to work wherever you want, however you want. Whether it’s stepping away from the confines of your desk to working from anywhere within your home, you can create the ultimate wireless setup with minimal effort. 
Luna will connect as long as both devices are on the same WiFi network. You can even take your workflow outdoors with a strong WiFi connection.

We've spent years building Luna’s custom video compression technology we call LIQUID. Every line of LIQUID code was originally written to meet the demands of pro artists, and the result is stunning image quality and responsiveness. That means Luna can keep up with any heavy-duty workflow.

Unlike our competitors, Luna’s custom-engineering guarantees consistent performance across all of your favorite PC programs. Enjoy the same reliability of a traditional monitor but the flexibility of your iPad. 


Take your mobile workspace on the go without worrying about a bunch of cords or heavy clip-on screens. Just pack your laptop, iPad, and Luna and you’re ready to go! 
Luna’s hardware dongle is discreet, compact, and beautifully designed. Unlike other bulky tech accessories that take up space, Luna fits neatly in the compact box that it’s sent in.
Each box contains a Luna dongle, sculpted foam packing to safely hold it in place, and a simple card with instructions to help you get set up in seconds.


Luna Display for Windows is available in two port types — USB-C or HDMI. 
If you’re a Mac user, Luna is available in USB-C or Mini DisplayPort (available for immediate purchase at lunadisplay.com). The USB-C version is compatible with both PC and Mac. 
Your purchase includes the Luna Display hardware unit along with access to the free Luna Display desktop and iPad apps.  
NOTE: Luna for Mac is available in both mDP and USB-C. However, Luna USB-C for Mac will only contain Windows support after the Kickstarter. If you choose to purchase Luna USB-C through our Kickstarter, you'll receive special Kickstarter discounts and support our Windows effort.  


Tens of thousands of happy Mac users have already transformed their workflows with Luna Display. Here’s what they have to say —
“Really enjoying my new set up, thanks to Luna Display! Such a great tool to expand workflows. 🙌”  —Travis V.
“Genuinely blown away by how well it works. Never thought I’d ever be able to use a desktop computer whilst laying on the sofa. Thanks Luna Display!” —Alastair M.
"This little device from Luna Display is incredible! It allows me to use an iPad as a second screen wirelessly with retina resolution. 2 min out of the box and up and running. 👍”  —Shane D.
“Much needed second screen for my 13”MBP when not at my desk. Big workflow gain. Works great over WiFi or tethered USB.” —David T.
“I just got my Luna Display in the mail, and it's incredible. Truly feels like the iPad Pro is just another monitor.” —Zack K.
“Really happy with my LunaDisplay. I use it constantly when I travel. Such a beautifully engineered solution, a real “It just works” piece of kit.” —Harrison T. 
“This device is such a game changer for me. For somebody that works offsite and needs more screen real estate in apps like After Effects, Luna Display knocks it out of the park. And there’s little to no lag because it works off a solid WiFi connection. Highly recommend!!” —Miles F.
“I can take my iPad and the mouse to another part of a room and control the Mac - perfect for home recording / microphone chamber. Luna Display is great!” —Hannes O.
“I’ve tried almost all of the ‘use your iPad as a second display’ options and the ONLY one that legitimately delivered on the promise is Luna Display – thank you for making this!” —Stephen S.
“Still can’t believe how solid Luna has been day to day. Literally feels like I’m using a retina touch screen Mac when it’s open.” —Daniel P.
“Just set up my Luna Display! I don't remember the last time I've ever been so excited about a piece of tech. My two screens and I thank you.”  —Lauren B.
“The speed and resolution are head and shoulders over software-only solutions!” —Martin L. 

Simply plug in Luna, launch the apps, and your devices will automatically connect! Luna for Windows is available for USB-C or HDMI.

Plug Luna into your Windows computer. (You do not need to plug in a Luna into your iPad!)
Launch the respective Luna Display apps on your Windows computer and your iPad. 
Now you're up and running! 


With full support for external keyboards, Apple Pencil, and touch interactions, Luna allows you to harness the power of your PC while extending your display to the iPad. Here’s what you need to get started:
A laptop or desktop computer running Windows
Any modern iPad
A strong WiFi connection or USB cable to connect PC and iPad 
Works with any modern Windows PC: 
Minimum Requirements 
Operation system: Microsoft Windows 10 64-bit, Build 1809 or later
Processor: Intel or AMD processor with 64-bit support; 2 GHz or faster
RAM: 4 GB
GPU: Intel HD Graphics 520, AMD Radeon RX Vega 3, NVIDIA GeForce 820M or later; or equivalent DirectX 11 compatible GPU.
Hard drive space: 1 GB
WiFi/Network: 802.11n or wired ethernet
Recommended Requirements
Operation system: Microsoft Windows 10 64-bit, Build 1809 or later
Processor: Intel or AMD processor with 64-bit support; 3 GHz or faster
RAM: 8 GB
GPU: Intel Iris Plus Graphics G7, AMD Radeon RX Vega 9, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 850M or later; or equivalent DirectX 11 compatible GPU
Hard drive space: 1 GB
WiFi/Network: 802.11ac or wired ethernet
Works with any modern iPad and Apple Pencil: 
Minimum iPad Requirements
iPad Mini 2 (2013 or later)
iPad Pro (2016 or later)
iPad 5th generation (2017 or later)
iPad Air (2013 or later)
iPad must be running iOS 9.1 (or later)
32-bit devices are not supported



Luna fully integrates with Astropad Standard and Studio — our award-winning drawing software that turns the iPad into a professional graphics tablet. We’re launching Astropad for Windows next year.

Astropad offers complete workflow customization, featuring a packed suite full of creatives tools like unlimited workflow shortcuts, Magic Gestures, and custom pressure curves. Pairing Luna with Astropad gives professional creatives the freedom and flexibility that their workflow deserves.
Count on your fingers to give you a hand! You don’t have to go to Hogwarts to use Magic Gestures. Save room in the sidebar by assigning frequently-used shortcuts to finger-touch and tap interactions.
Put the pressure on, or take the pressure off! Whichever way you lean, we’ve got you covered. If the automatic pressure sensitivity of the Apple Pencil doesn’t work for you, no sweat! Customize the pressure curve to your individual drawing preferences.
The curve settings in Studio helps you preview your adjustments, so you can better understand the changes you’re making. Test the curve’s pressure sensitivities at any time by pressing anywhere on your screen outside of the sidebar while the Pressure Curve settings are open.
Who said taking shortcuts has to be a bad thing? No matter what your workload might look like, we’ll keep up with you. Set up your perfect workflow and tool alignment just once, so you can come back to your perfectly-organized, on-screen desk every time. Free up your time and self to creativity!
Shortcuts automatically adjust when you switch apps, too. Even if you haven’t already established shortcuts for an app, the Studio shortcut sidebar comes equipped with the most common tools in each app to get you started!


We’re a small but mighty team of problem-solvers, creatives, engineers, and dreamers. 
Astropad was founded in 2013 by two former Apple engineers, Matt Ronge and Giovanni Donelli. Today, we’re a nimble crew of 16 people. Within our tiny powerhouse, we have a Windows-focused engineering team; a Luna hardware and firmware team; and a dedicated team of technical support experts. 
We’ve always been a fully-remote company, with team members located around the world. Because of this, we’ve made it our mission to build products that make life easier for other creative people that work remote. 
We’re a 100% bootstrapped company. We’ve never taken outside investment, which is why we rely on communities like Kickstarter to help bring our products to life. 
PLAY

 A look at our prototypes:
Here's a demo of the prototype hardware we used to shoot our main video:
PLAY



We are looking for your support through Kickstarter to help us pay for our next large-scale manufacturing round. Here’s what Luna’s development timeline looks like:
We originally launched Luna Display for Mac on Kickstarter in 2017. Our campaign was wildly successful, raising over $645K — 2,100% more than our original funding goal!
Now we’re back and ready to bring Luna Display to Windows. And this time around, we’ve streamlined every aspect of Luna’s production, so we can ship to you as soon as possible:
— Strengthened relationship with our manufacturing partner 
Over the past few years, we’ve cultivated a loyal and transparent relationship with our manufacturing partner in China. Before the pandemic, our cofounder Giovanni was taking quarterly trips to our factory to assess assembly processes and product quality. Over these many trips, we’ve built a strong partnership with our Chinese team, and they are excited to come on this journey with us to launch Luna to the Windows market! 
— Scaled up distribution to accommodate more volume and countries
Our distribution center in Atlanta, Georgia has scaled up to accommodate increased volume with our new Windows market. And since our last Kickstarter, we’ve expanded our shipping capabilities to over 55 countries around the world. Our shipping timelines have been on-time and on-track, with few impacts since the pandemic hit. 
— Tripled the size of our Technical Support Team
In preparation for the Windows community, we’ve tripled the size of our Technical Support Team. Timely and thorough responses are our top priority, as well as fully understanding our exciting new customer base. Our Support Team also works hand-in-hand with our Engineering Team for troubleshooting and providing immediate product feedback.  
— Hired a team of dedicated Windows engineers
To build the best product experience possible, we hired a team of talented software engineers that are dedicated to Windows compatibility. As we launch Luna for Windows, our engineering team is standing by to fix bugs and launch new product features!

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
— Developing cross-platform technology 
We knew that building Luna Display for Windows would be an uphill battle. Like all of our products, we started from scratch. This meant learning an entirely new coding language and rebuilding our core Liquid technology to be faster, more durable, and work smoothly on Windows. We also hired a new team of Windows developers to help us ramp up development.

— Getting to know the Windows community 
In our cross-platform journey, we’ve had to admit that we’re in new territory, which means understanding a new audience. As we make strides in delivering on our Windows promise, we’re dedicated to making our products better than ever. To better understand our new Windows audience, we’ll be conducting ongoing market research about how our users like to be productive with Luna Display. 

— Production during a global pandemic 
Now that we’re approaching the finish line, we’re cognizant of the risks of production during the COVID-19 pandemic. It’s our goal to ship Luna Display for Windows on-time, but the health and safety of the employees producing our USB-C and HDMI units is critical. It’s our goal to be 100% transparent with you about our production journey. We’ll be sharing biweekly updates through Kickstarter to keep you informed on our timeline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
More than just a remote, Arsenal 2 uses AI and computational photography to help you create amazing photos and timelapses.
After shipping over 100,000 units, we're back with huge improvements to our intelligent photography assistant for DSLR and mirrorless cameras. 
With a single tap Arsenal 2’s AI determines the optimal settings for the scene you're shooting. Using its new and improved sensors, Arsenal 2 fine tunes your camera's settings by analyzing 22 different environmental factors. The result is great settings for any shot.  
Arsenal 2’s Deep Color uses a neural network to intelligently develop each photo. Deep Color is not a look or a filter. Instead, it produces a set of adjustments custom to each photo. The results are balanced yet powerful, rendering bold images that flatter every photo without being over the top. See the difference below compared to a camera's built-in colors. 
See our “How it works” section below for more details.
Arsenal 2 controls your camera over USB and automates some of the most powerful photography techniques. The onboard GPU automatically stacks photos and sends them to your phone—or saves them to Arsenal 2’s micro SD card slot (See FAQ for details). 
Night photography is notoriously difficult. Arsenal 2’s Night Assist makes it easy. It can focus on the stars with a tap*, then calculate the perfect settings to get sharp, detailed night photos.
*Night focus times vary by camera and lens. Night focus normally requires between 30 seconds and 2 minutes to get stars in perfect focus. See the FAQ for lens compatibility.
Panoramas make for powerful photos, but there’s too much guessing involved. With Arsenal 2’s live panorama, you can be sure you didn’t miss anything. The Arsenal Phone Mount accessory (sold separately) holds Arsenal 2 and your phone, so you can watch the panorama build as you shoot. When you’re done, crop the final output and it's ready to share.
In some locations, there will always be someone in your photo. By combining multiple shots, Arsenal 2’s new Crowd Control feature can automatically remove people and other moving objects from your photos.
Arsenal 2 ships in Standard and Pro versions. Both have the same software features (and support the same cameras), but Arsenal 2 Pro brings even more performance improvements, added weather resistance, and USB-C connectivity. 
*Micro SD card sold separately, see the "Accessories" section below

Arsenal 2 automates advanced photo stacking techniques to help you capture scenes with High Dynamic Range (HDR). In seconds, Arsenal 2 takes multiple exposures and blends them into a single shot capturing details in both bright and dark areas of the scene.
With Arsenal 2, you can create long exposures that capture rich color and dramatic motion blurs...without buying expensive neutral density filters.
With focus stacking, you can get your entire scene in sharp focus. Arsenal 2 calculates the ideal aperture, takes shots at different focus positions, and merges them into one crystal clear image.
We love timelapses, so we spent five years designing the ultimate timelapse tool. Start your timelapse with a tap...or set custom parameters. Arsenal 2 will intelligently manage the exposure to create a smooth day-to-night transition. You can even preview your timelapse while it’s being recorded. You (and your phone) can leave. Come back any time to change settings or check progress. Arsenal 2 takes care of the rest. 
Arsenal 2's powerful new processors allow for faster intervals, smoother transitions, and higher quality previews.
Check out some of our timelapses shot with Arsenal 2.

Arsenal 2 lets you control your camera from up to 100 feet away. Tap to focus, set shutter speed, aperture, and ISO; see a live preview; and take the shot—all from your phone.
Sharing photos from your DSLR or mirrorless camera shouldn’t be hard. Use Arsenal 2 to automatically sync full-resolution photos to your phone, or send individual photos to your favorite apps with a tap.
Check out our Deep Color gallery for more examples.
Arsenal 2 supports over 100 popular DSLR and mirrorless camera models, 23 of which are new for Arsenal 2. 
Click here to view all supported cameras
Arsenal 2 controls your camera via a USB cable (included), and you control Arsenal 2 wirelessly from your phone. Arsenal 2’s free mobile app is compatible with modern iOS and Android devices. 
 Arsenal 2 Pro works with all of the same cameras as Arsenal 2 Standard. 
Hi, my name is Ryan. I’m a software developer, photographer, and the creator of Arsenal. I love learning. Photography let me learn something new and experience more of the beauty we have here in Montana. Arsenal started as a way to improve my own photography.
When I launched the original Arsenal campaign on Kickstarter, there was more demand that I ever expected. During the campaign, I was fortunate to be able to hire some of the smartest and most talented people I know. Three years on, we're still a small team. Yet thanks to everyone’s expertise, we’ve been able to do things normally exclusive to much larger companies.

Taxes will vary based on where your rewards are shipped (Sorry, I don’t make the rules). For the following countries, we're collecting taxes before shipping, so you won’t have to worry about paying them at the time of delivery, extra fees, or being held up in customs. 
 United States: State sales taxes apply in most states.

 Other Countries: We will not charge any taxes in the pledge manager. However, you may be responsible for sales tax, VAT/GST taxes, duties, import fees, or other taxes/fees when your reward is delivered.  
We plan to ship Arsenal 2 units directly to backers within the US, EU, UK, CA, and AU, using existing fulfillment partners with local warehouses. That means your rewards will arrive promptly with no international shipping hassles.
Media Inquiries

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter campaign. After our first campaign we delivered over 100,000 Arsenals to our backers across the globe. And along the way we built up tools, relationships, and expertise that will help us to deliver Arsenal 2. 

From a technology standpoint, much of the work that went into Arsenal 1 can be reused as a foundation for Arsenal 2 (both Standard and Pro). A lot of the work required to get Arsenal 1 out the door wasn’t feature specific, but involved things like camera integration, mobile app communication and deployment, firmware management, user interface design, bug tracking, etc. Having that foundation means we can spend more time optimizing performance and testing features. 

For Arsenal 2, we’ve completed all of the hardware development, and our manufacturing partners are already established and ready to go to production once parts are in. We’ve also expanded our Support team, hired a Logistics Manager, and upgraded our fulfillment partners so that shipping is quick and easy. 

Even with all of the planning we’ve done, issues always come up. COVID-19 adds another layer of challenges, and we've adjusted our schedule to reflect COVID realities. Could COVID-19 or something else throw us a curveball? You bet. With an expanded team of great people to support the launch, I’m confident we can address any complications that come up. And you have our commitment to handle any issues in a transparent way that makes you proud to be a part of the Arsenal community.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
AirBolt® GPS is the smart solution to all your tracking needs. When possessions or our dear pets go missing, the usual solutions just aren't good enough. 
That's why we created The AirBolt® GPS, a tracker perfect for every situation.

We're human; we misplace things; we have no idea how the keys got left in the fridge or where the cat has been all night. So, after a stressful night of searching for the cat and catching the bus the next morning because we couldn't find our keys, we knew something had to change.




What we came up with is The AirBolt® GPS. This tracker is perfect. It's small, only 37mm x 34mm x 11mm (1.45" x 1.34" x 0.43") and VERY lightweight (approx. 21 grams, 0.75oz). This means it can be hung from a collar or slipped discreetly in a pocket or bag. Since we knew Bluetooth wouldn't cut it, we decided we needed to use GPS.  
We took our tracking to the next level, however, by implementing location over LTE-M / NB-IoT, which are next-generation low-powered cellular networks. This way we would have the perfect balance of indoor, outdoor and nearby tracking. We then decided on an ever-growing network so we could track belongings globally.






*Gen 3 Onward


We are so proud of what The AirBolt® GPS can do. There are so many uses for every lifestyle that owning one just won't do!
The AirBolt® uses LTE-M/NB-IoT & GPS with the capability to provide quick and accurate location updates on demand.  Our tracking range is global and the list of covered countries is growing rapidly! Nearby tracking is also possible without subscription access, so you are never locked into subscriptions if you don’t want one!


Losing a pet is terrifying, so we designed the AirBolt® GPS to make lost pets a thing of the past. Track them anywhere, keep them safe and put your mind at ease. Set up Geo-Fencing and Separation Alerts, so you will immediately know if they have left the vicinity. The alert button can send you a message if someone else finds your pet.

Use AirBolt® GPS on a child's backpack. Perfect for when they start walking to school themselves, keeping track of sports bags, or locating school items that are missing or forgotten. Check the tracker at school pickup and see if they've left their library bag behind. 



Not a morning person? Don't worry about leaving your bag on the train, track your items and set a proximity alarm to alert you if you move away from your belongings.

You can even share access with your family, friends, colleagues or employees. Everyone can keep track of their own belongings.  This is also a great safety feature when travelling alone - share your location with friends and family so they know you’re safe!

Track your equipment, gear or even drones with our small, and VERY lightweight device. The AirBolt®GPS is designed to be versatile and fit all your hobbies.

Nature lover? The AirBolt® GPS is waterproof up to 1m (for 30minutes) with a built-in alert to let you know when it has been submerged.  Give access to your AirBolt® GPS and allow friends and family to know where you are surfing, skiing, hiking or camping.

Worried about your vehicles, tools or work equipment? The discrete size means you can place The AirBolt® GPS in your heavy vehicle, boat, trailer or toolbox without worry. 
Monitor when your equipment is being used or borrowed and where it's going. Put one in your glovebox to remember where you parked. Place it inside expensive equipment cases. You can even set up a proximity alarm and geo-fence to alert you if something leaves your worksite.

campaign.story:
Convenience and Security: The Mini BLE 
Data breaches are an unfortunate part of our reality, reminding us of the importance of unique and secure passwords for each service we use. For the last 3 and a half years, the Mooltipass Team has been working on what we're convinced is the best balance between ease-of-use and security – while keeping you in full control of your personal data.
The Mooltipass Mini BLE connects to any USB or Bluetooth Low Energy-capable device (phone, tablet, computer, etc). To use it, just insert your personal smartcard, unlock it with your PIN, and you're good to go. You'll be able to log in anywhere with a quick tap on the desk or a few tweaks of the scroll wheel!

But What Can It Do, Exactly?
Over Bluetooth Low Energy or USB, your Mooltipass Mini BLE can:
Automatically log you into websites using our Chrome, Firefox or Opera extensions
Let you use the secure WebAuthn authentication technology
 Behave like a keyboard to type credentials or text on any device
Display text and credentials on its OLED screen
Automatically log you in to your computer
Store and recall small files or notes
Because our device is completely open-source, the Mooltipass team – together with contributors from all over the globe – is continuously adding new features. Even after your device reaches your doorstep, you'll be able to update it securely to get new functionality.

 Why Should You Use a Dedicated Device? 
Many people use software tools to store and organize their passwords. That's a great first step, but consider what happens if a piece of particularly nasty malware compromises your computer. It can steal your password database, and the next time you use your software tool to log in to a website, the malware can steal your master password. This isn't just hypothetical: something similar happened to a well-known password vault. Since we decouple the decryption key from your computer, it becomes much harder for a malicious program to make off with all of your account information.
Do You Use the Same Password (or a Set of Similar Passwords) in Multiple Places? 
Well, you've certainly solved the problem of remembering your passwords, but have you considered what happens if one of those services is compromised and your password is stolen? The attacker now knows the email address you used to register for the service and your reused password. He can now use them to access a lot of information about you. For example:
E-bill reminders
Bank information
Accounts for online merchants
And all the other services you use...
Hopefully you haven't used the same password for any of those services... but don't forget many services will email you a password reset link. With all of this information at their fingertips, a malicious person can easily take control of your online life! 
OK, So You Used a Different Password for Your Email Address... But What About the Password Reset Questions?
Many people's accounts are compromised because they did nothing more than choose security questions to which the answers are easily guessed or can be found online. Your high school, or mother's maiden name? Perhaps those can be found on your Facebook account or LinkedIn profile. The Mini can help here, too. You can have it remember obscure answers to security questions for you!
As You Can See, the Strength of Your Security is Only as Strong as the Weakest Part.
As clichéd as it sounds, the only way to ensure your accounts stay secure is to use unique and complex passwords for each one. That's why we created the Mooltipass devices – to make it easy to start (and continue) good security practices for all of your online accounts. The Mooltipass can even help you out by generating long, complex, random passwords whenever you create a new account or change an existing password.

The Unique Mooltipass Mini BLE Architecture
For maximum device security, the Mooltipass team decided to split our device 'brain' in two. One processor is in charge of the complex protocols for communicating with the outside world, while the other handles all security-related features. While this substantially increased our development effort, it also dramatically increases security.

Customize Your Security Level
When it comes to security, we all have our preferences. Some prefer letting the device do what it needs to, while others prefer to approve each operation that needs to be performed. That's why the Mooltipass Mini BLE includes both an "easy" and an "advanced" mode. The latter allows you to customize your security preferences and enables other advanced features such as credential categories. Want to know more? Have a look at our user manual.

The Mooltipass Ecosystem Security Model
The Mooltipass Mini BLE has the same security model as its brothers and sisters – namely:
 A Smartcard – To store the AES-256 encryption key for your protected information securely. This disconnects the encryption key from your secured data, meaning that even if your computer is compromised, the encryption key cannot be accessed by malicious software on the machine.
 PIN-based Authentication – 4 wrong PIN entries and the card will self-destruct, putting a significant damper on the viability of brute-force attacks with a stolen card. Don't worry, it's easy to duplicate your access card securely, so you'll have a backup if something happens to the original!
 Tamper Detection – To ensure nobody has tinkered with your Mooltipass Mini BLE, its aluminum case includes a mechanism that prevents opening without deforming the case.You'll know instantly if it's been altered.
 Fully Encrypted Backups – You can rest assured knowing that the backup files are encrypted using the same key stored on your smartcard. Even if someone compromises your computer (or cloud storage account) and obtains the exported data, they will not be able to decrypt your passwords.
 Secure Firmware Updates – The Mooltipass Mini BLE includes a way to update the firmware safely, using digital signatures. This allows you to take advantage of new features on your device as we develop them!

Multiple Users, Multiple Cards... I'm Lost! 
We realize that all the possibilities that the Mooltipass ecosystem offers can be confusing at first. Here's what you should know about Mooltipass devices:
 One Mini BLE can be shared by multiple people, each with their own card
 One person can use multiple Mooltipass Minis, the same card for all of them
 Smartcards can be cloned safely without compromising security
 Credentials are encrypted safely inside the Mooltipass Mini BLE 
 Credentials can be exported safely– backups are encrypted!
 You only need to remember one card PIN to access all your credentials 

WebAuthn Passwordless Authentication
You may have heard about WebAuthn. To simplify a bit, it makes passwords obsolete by authenticating you securely with signed cryptographic challenges. You simply need to approve a prompt on the device and – ta-da! – you're logged in. Yes, the Mooltipass Mini BLE supports it!

The Mooltipass Mini BLE Software Companion
Moolticute was created 5 years ago by one of our contributors and, soon after, became the official open-source software companion for Mooltipass devices. Among others, Moolticute allows you to:
Use native browser integration on Chrome, Firefox and Opera
Import, export and synchronize your credentials
Fully customize your Mooltipass device behavior
Save and recall files stored on the device
Add, delete and modify your credentials
Mass import unencrypted credentials
Update your device securely

Our Commitment to Open Source
Our team believes that great security can only be achieved through complete transparency. That's why we have been publishing everything that goes into making the Mooltipass on our GitHub repository from the project's start.
Just like Linux-based operating systems, open source allows our product to benefit from many engineers' expertise. This results in better code quality, more trust from our final users and verified security implementation.
We publish everything we do to provide you with the best possible security device.

Do You Want to Contribute?
Do you also share our passion for open source security and want to contribute? Send us a message to join our development team. With the development board you see above, we are making it easy to test code on the Mooltipass Mini BLE.

Hardware Specifications
The Mooltipass Mini BLE is designed with you in mind. It is made of scratch-resistant aluminum and is small enough to be carried in your pocket. Compared to our previous device, the mini BLE includes a new ruggedized scroll wheel for an easy scrolling experience through your credentials.
 Device Size: 89 x 35.5 x 12.5mm
 Working Voltage: 4.75V to 5.25V
 Battery Type: NiMH 300mAh
 Connector: USB-C 2.0 (full speed)
 Internal Memory: 8Mb
 Smart Card Support: AT88SC102
 True Random Number Generation 
 Interface Type: clickable scroll wheel
 Case Material: Brushed Anodized Aluminum
 Display: 256x64 4bits per pixel 2.08" blue OLED screen

Device Languages, Unicode Support
Languages are regularly being added to our device. At the time of writing, the Mooltipass Mini BLE supports English, German, Spanish, French, Slovenian, Portuguese, Croatian, and Finnish. If you'd like to help us add others, please get in touch with us! We're also planning to add support for Asian and Arabic fonts.

Post-Kickstarter Campaign Timeline
As with our two previous crowdfunding campaigns, we will provide regular progress updates until your unit(s) arrive at your door. While 40 beta testers have been using our devices during the last 6 months, there are still a few nice-to-haves and mass-production related features we need to implement before the Mooltipass Mini BLE code is completely ready. 
Our crowdfunding campaign will finish at the end of August, so we are planning to use the months of September, October and possibly November to implement the aforementioned features, in addition to:
designing and producing the device packaging
designing our custom mass programming rig 
passing CE/FCC & Bluetooth certifications
setting up our fulfillment center
briefing our device assembler
selecting USB-C cables
We are not expecting any unpleasant surprises,  as we'll mostly be repeating what we've already done with the Mooltipass Mini! However, the current pandemic situation will likely force us to conduct more of these production tasks remotely.
If all goes well, we anticipate device assembly will take place in November or December so you could see your device by Christmas or in January!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Mooltipass project has been ongoing since 2014, and the Mini BLE has been under development during the last three years and a half. The core team from the Mooltipass product is still at the helm, bringing all of their experience and knowledge from before, in addition to the things we learned from our two previous devices.

The main risk for our project is one the world is very familiar with : the current COVID-19 pandemic.
In January 2020, our flight to go to Hong Kong to meet again our device assembler was cancelled. We have worked with him remotely since then but we however still need to go there to bring RF testing equipment and to pass CE, FCC and Bluetooth certifications.
Unless the travel ban stays for many months, we prefer continuing the partnership we have built with these companies over the last 7 years.

As much as we'd like to guarantee a smooth production run without hiccups, there will always be unpredictable events that may arise when producing large quantities of an item. Rest assured that we will do our best to keep you informed for the duration of the project, and until you have your device in your hands!

*note: this is "all or nothing" funding - the project will only be funded if it reaches it's goal (https://help.kickstarter.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005047893 ).
Bridge players, more than ever, are playing this fantastic mindsport and past-time online.  We want to do it better.  We have started to make the world's best online Bridge software - and all open source, so others can benefit and contribute.
How the online services interact with platforms and 3rd party services
We are in the process of building a complete modern Bridge platform where bridge players
can play an informal match with friends
can play a match with their bridge club
can invite a partner (or robot) to join in any match by URL (link)
can watch one or more live or recorded matches in a multi-pane viewer, e.g. both tables at a teams match
...with many more features for players, clubs, teachers, TDs, NBOs, 3rd party business & software developers , all documented here
Freemium (free and micro-payments) for platforms. Our own bridge playing platforms are free for users (who we will never charge), ultra-low cost to bridge organisations (Clubs, Regionals, Nationals) who charge table money.  independently, to their users. Note: table money payments, will never be processed by us, they go 100% to the organisation, just as they in face-to-face games. 
Freemium (free and micro-payments) for services.  Low-cost provision of online bridge  services (Deal, DDS, OCR, etc) for-profit businesses.
Our funding model is not fully set yet, but it is looking like a mixture of donations, grants and API key revenue.
Our costs are primarily cloud platform charges. Every penny of donations will be spent on our cloud to enable us to build more scalable, faster services and platforms.
Our team consists of an international group of leads (current, subject to change): Adam Wildavsky (US), Daniel Braun (AU), Shen Ting Ang (SG), Zhivko Draganov (BG), Nuno Damaso (PT), Teodor Totev (BG), David Synnott (IE), Jean-Pierre Desmoulins (FR), Pauli (FI) & Kiat Huang (UK) - full info here bit.ly/bridge-hackathon
Our code repositories reside on the Bridge Hackathon github and our default license is the permissive (open source) MIT License.
Background. There are online bridge playing platforms, some old some new, but they share in common that they are non-collaborative, and they are not, generally open source.  They also tend be limited in extensibility and sometimes buggy. Players and organisations use them because there is nothing better.
Come Join Us. A wide variety of roles are available.  Get involved!
*note: this is "all or nothing" funding - the project will only be funded if it reaches it's goal (https://help.kickstarter.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005047893 ).
Kiat Huang (Bridge Hackathon co-founder and principal organiser)

Summary
Hello!  My name is Kindra and I live in Seattle, Washington.  I am the founder of PursePal™ - The Anti Theft Purse/Bag Lock for Women and Men. 
I have been manufacturing a variety of women's purse accessories since 2012 and have mainly been selling my products on Etsy or similar websites.  My other purse related products have all been smaller scale, with me producing them by hand in my spare time.
This is my first crowd funding project ;-)
 2019 marked the highest ever reported incidents of purse and bag snatching nationwide. 
Thieves are growing bolder with lifting purses/bags out of shopping carts, park benches, parked vehicles, dining tables and more while you are focused else ware.  It is not just a local rising concern here in Seattle, but nationwide!
Due to Covid-19 and it's global effects, 2020 theft rates are already on the rise. Up 25% in some parts of the United States. 
 PursePal™ aims to prevent theft by securing your bag while not in hand, so you can focus on your day.  Whether it be picking up groceries at the local market or pushing your child on a swing at a neighborhood park,  PursePal™ has your back!
We lock our houses, we lock our cars, isn't it about time we lock our bags and purses?
With your support, we can help in reducing these growing statistics.  As well as bring comfort and security back to men and women when they are out and about during their day.
PursePal™ will be my first larger scale product that I feel every man or women can greatly benefit from.  Originally, it was my niece Emma that sparked the idea of a purse/bag lock.  One day while grocery shopping, I asked her to watch my purse while I grabbed something down the aisle.  She then asked me why don't I have a lock for my purse.  It was at this moment, I realized nothing like this existed and the idea of PursePal™ began.  I then took the idea to a close friend of mine who is an amazing innovator and engineer.  Within three weeks, we had a prototype.  Then after another three months of testing and further prototypes, we had our final production design.
 High Break Strength
Secure your bag with peace of mind.  Features a 100lb elastic cord and a 60lb locking mechanism.
Even the strongest of strong cannot go up against it!
Quick lock and unlock 
With the proper knowledge, add or remove easily using two hands.  No key or combination to hassle with in slowing down your day.  Don't be fooled though, you have to be familiar and practiced on how to unlock it properly.   Thieves lift bags within a second or two and are looking for the fastest getaway.  PursePal has your back!
Lightweight & easily stowed
Feather light at only 18 grams and with an overall length of two inches, it easily stows in your purse or bag while not in use.  Drop it in or secure it to one of your straps for even easier access for next use.
Cut Resistant
Our elastic cord is not only strong, but resilient to withstand attempted cutting.  Specially designed elastic cord creates a loud popping sound if compromised to notify bag owner.
Let the color pop!
Choose from a variety of loud or soft cord and lock colors.  Make a statement to all with your personalized color combination.
Protection in your car!
Protection while dining!
Protection at the playground!
Protection at your outdoor event!
Protection at da club!
Color Choices!
What We Need & What You Get
Because of our limited budget, we are seeking to raise funds to initiate production and allow PursePal into the hands of thousands of people.   The locks we use are custom made and machined.  We can produce a limited quantity using our in house lathe and drill press etc.  However, to produce higher quantities, we sought out help by a local machine shop here in Seattle.  This machine shop has a minimum start up cost of $5,000 to build a custom jig for our project.  After this initial setup, they can produce these locks for us on an as needed basis and with a low minimum order quantity of 50 units.
This is how we arrived to our campaign goal amount.  
After three prototypes and lots of testing, we are ready for production!   That being said, we estimate shipping to take place soon after this campaign ends.  Est June 2020.  Although delays can occur, we do not foresee many.   We will keep everyone current with updates throughout the campaign as well as in post.
 We have a fairly large amount of material ready to go.  We can also quickly obtain more of our raw components when required. 
PERKS!
Supporter - Don't wish to order a PursePal™ but still want to show your support?  Your contributions are greatly appreciated and will be used to further grow the PursePal brand and it's reach to the world.
One Pack - Wish to order just one?  This is your reward!
Bundle Packs - Wish to order more than one?  Thinking ahead for Christmas gifts this year?  Save even more with our two, three or ten pack! 
STRETCH GOAL!
If we surpass $10k in our campaign, we will add even more amazing cord colors!  Including camouflage, neon color(s) and white!
The Team
Other Ways You Can Help
Our website is finished, however we cannot take orders through it unless we reach our funding goal here on Kickstarter.  Orders will not be fufilled through our website until our backer rewards here are on Kickstarter have been delivered.  Save 30% or more by supporting our product here on Kickstarter.  If you wish to check it out though, please do.  Share it anyway to you can!  www.MyPursePal.com
If you like the idea of PursePal but cannot support our product at this time, we would greatly appreciate you spreading the word any way you can.  Share our campaign here on social media or simply tell a friend.  It all helps!  My niece Emma thanks you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Because PursePal is ready for production, we do not foresee many future issues with fulfilling rewards of our backers. All material sources have been acquired and relationships formed with these companies. There is no MOQ (minimum order quantity) for raw materials but we do get price breaks after a certain amount which is why we hope to exceed our campaign goal. ;)

As stated in our story, the local machine shop here in Seattle that we are going to use to machine our locks have a minimum start up cost of $5,000. This machine shop has been around for over 10 years and we do not see them going anywhere or changing their quoted price. However, we have already sourced two alternative machine shops we can use as back ups in case this shop for whatever reason cannot be used when required.

The remaining materials we use for PursePal can be obtained from multiple sources if needed as well.

Other than the custom made locks, we will be hand assembling each and every PursePal. Our small team can produce approximately 35 units per hour. However, we can always obtain more help if we greatly exceed our campaign goal.

If our campaign surpasses $50k (approx 2500 units) reward fulfillment will need to be pushed back to approximately October 2020. This will allow us time to get more help, gather more materials, machine the locks, get them assembled and shipped.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
The materials used in each PursePal are designed to be long lasting. The elastic cords are fade resistant against age or sun exposure. The locks being steel/alloy are rust resistant. The ink which is used on the "PursePal" logo is UV rated against fading through time and sun exposure as well.
Environmentally friendly factories
Because we will only be outsourcing our custom made machined locks, we will be assembling 90% of PursePal in house. These custom locks have very low waste. The machine shop also recycles all the waste it gathers from jobs including ours. 

Because the remaining assembly of each PursePal is done by hand, there is zero emissions or waste!
Sustainable Distribution
We will be using Uline recycled bubble mailers for our backer delivery. With larger orders being packed with recycled packing peanuts.

USPS (United States Postal Service) will be picking up our shipments from our facility. Because of this, we will not be wasting fuel driving daily to the post office to ship our rewards to our backers.

updates.update_userinfo: New Feature of Purse Pal Discovered!
updates.update_content: Thanks to question a backer here on Kickstarter recently asked us, we have discovered a new feature of PursePal!  This never occurred to us until after reading her message.  If you have more than one PursePal, you can connect them together to increase the stretchable reach.  This can come in handy if you are trying to secure your bag/purse to an object with a larger circumference.  Each PursePal has a stretchable reach of up to two feet.  Therefore, if you have two PursePal's working together, you have a stretchable reach of up to four feet.  We have thoroughly tested using more than one unit together and the break strength remains the same.

campaign.story:
FLUXBAG - The Smarter Air Pump
Ever faced the challenge of inflating anything? How did it go? It's usually a pain, one way or the other, isn’t it? Here's how we can change things for the better:
The FLUXBAG is a revolutionary new kind of air pump that inflates items like pool toys, air mattresses or sleeping pads effortlessly and in an instant. It is practically a "self-inflating air pump": You simply connect it to your inflatable, breath into it JUST ONCE, and then push 100/140L of air effortlessly into your inflatable item. 
The FLUXBAG, in a nutshell, is an air pump without the effort, much faster, smaller and more lightweight than other air pumps, and doubles as a huge XXL dry bag or a comfy beach pillow. 

We successfully launched the FLUXBAG here on Kickstarter back in 2016. Now we are returning with an extensively tried and tested, much more sophisticated and matured product. All connector, adapter, and nozzle parts have been redesigned to make the FLUXBAG compatible with virtually all valves that you'll find with inflatables in the leisure segment. You will also be able to 3D-print your own custom nozzle.  
(1) EFFORTLESS: Inflate items with just ONE breath
You simply blow into the FLUXBAG just once or twice - no wind or running necessary
For many inflatables just ONE breath and the force of gravity is all that it takes to fully inflate them. How on earth can this work? How would you inflate a 100/140L bag with only the 3 liters of air that your lungs can hold? It's smartly applied physics called the Bernoulli Principle: 
Blow into the FLUXBAG once or twice to fill it in just a few seconds ..
The "breathing jet" you create by exhaling into the FLUXBAG somewhat counterintuitively creates a lower air pressure in the bag. The surrounding air is then sucked into the FLUXBAG - you close it quickly and have 100/140 liters available to push into most any inflatable of your liking. It's the same physical effect that makes aircrafts fly.
.. then push 100/140L of air effortlessly into your inflatable
Thus the FLUXBAG does not need any wind, nor do you need to run around with it or hopelessly wave it through the air, unlike those – often highly dysfunctional – inflatable beach sofa loungers.
(2) FASTER: Continuous airflow through optimized nozzles
Unlike conventional manual air pumps, the FLUXBAG creates a powerful continuous airflow that you achieve just by using gravity and your body's weight instead of your muscles or lungs. What's more, our nozzle geometries are optimised for maximum airflow
Compared to a run-of-the-mill battery-powered electric air pump, the FLUXBAG not only performs faster but is also much more portable and uses far fewer resources to manufacture. Someone made a quick one-minute YouTube video running both devices side by side. (Text inserts are in German, but you'll surely get the idea..)  
Another advantage of the FLUXBAG – compared to standard 15-to 20-dollar electric pumps: You can exert a higher air pressure with it and thus FULLY inflate your e.g. pool toy or air bed which then won’t be as "floppy" as if they have been inflated with an electric pump.
A few examples, tested with the new FLUXBAG PRO

(3) SMALLER & LIGHTER: More bang for the gram
The FLUXBAG is literally pocket-sized and weighs less than 150 grams. We achieve this by using very lightweight but highly durable fabrics that you find with other professional outdoor gear. That 150g is only 1/5 the weight of other air pumps.
The FLUXBAG is much lighter - but also a lot smaller than other air pumps
(4) MULTIPLE USES: Doubles as an XXL dry bag or a beach pillow
Also a very large and very lightweight dry bag
It's 3-in-1: Many love the FLUXBAG's double use as a huge dry bag. When backpacking with only a small tent, the FLUXBAG is perfect to store stuff outside. Or use it as a backpack liner for extra water protection, or perhaps as a sturdy, reusable laundry bag. Since it comes with an air-tight lid, just form a triple knot with the roll-up closure's ends to turn it into a pillow, and you can quite comfortably rest your head or back against the FLUXBAG when you want to relax on the beach or on a trekking tour.
Need a pillow on the beach or on a trekking tour? FLUXBAG has you covered.
 A few quick demo videos..

FLUXBAG 3rd Generation: All new features and fittings 
This is the product we always wanted to make. We completely redesigned all the nozzles and connector parts and even added new ones. We optimised geometries, surface coarseness, and the material's elasticity. The silicone coating on the conical nozzles is a world's first. All this allows for significantly higher air pressures. It is like the "Porsche of air pump nozzle sets".
The FLUXBAG now reliably connects with all common valves
You will also be able to 3D-print your own custom nozzle if you like. Scroll down for details.
Any kind or brand of outdoor sleeping pads will fit any FLUXBAG now
The new FLUXBAG 3.0 now perfectly connects with ALL outdoor sleeping pads, regardless of the manufacturer. With a direct flat-valve connection (2 sizes) and our trusted silicone tube adapters (4 flexible tubes) for screw-top valves in all sizes, like e.g. Therm-a-rest, we now have the most versatile and practical solution. 
The new blow-back-protected connector now allows the FLUXBAG to inflate even the largest balloons
We also added a built-in non-return valve into the new FLUXBAGs that prevents the air from flowing back when you apply multiple "fluxes" to inflate larger items such as older air beds or even the largest pool floats. The FLUXBAG is the world's first and only pump sack with that feature.
The new extension trunk makes it a lot easier to connect the FLUXBAG with larger inflatables
We made an extension trunk as a new add-on that improves the FLUXBAG's functionality with hard-to-reach valves that are typically found on large aquatic toys or inflatable boats. While this accessory will sell separately for 10 USD/EUR later, we are tossing it in for FREE with every FLUXBAG pre-ordered here on Kickstarter. 
The new FLUXBAGs come with an illustrated user guide
Finally, there will be a new extensively-illustrated manual that will help you to make the most of your new FLUXBAG. Although the product is very easy to use, it takes a bit of practice to get a hang of it. The new manual will help you to achieve that within minutes.
Please note that the FLUXBAG is only suitable for low to medium air pressure items. The physics unfortunately do not allow for use with high-pressure items such as bicycle tires, SUPs, surf kites or heavy-duty rafts - unless you weigh a metric ton. As a rule of thumb: If you could inflate it with your mouth and lungs or a standard electric pump, you can also do it with a FLUXBAG.
Project timeline and use of funds
We will use the funds we raise from you guys here on Kickstarter to make the rather expensive steel molds for the new plastic parts and weld the new extension trunks. 
All the textile FLUXBAG bodies (the actual "bag" part) have been manufactured already – and they're just great!  
All the textile parts have been manufactured already and are of outstanding quality
Pick your FLUXBAG! What's in the pack?
Top: FLUXBAG PRO (140L, Nylon) Bottom: FLUXBAG FUN (100L, Polyester)
FLUXBAG 3.0 comes in two sizes, and both variations are fitted with the same sets of accessories. When it comes to choosing your FLUXBAG, the major differences are capacity and – to a certain extent – handling:
FLUXBAG PRO specs
The FLUXBAG PRO's 140-liters capacity allows you to quickly inflate even the largest items. Its 60cm-wide opening makes filling it slightly more challenging than with the only 50cm-wide FUN version since the Bernoulli principle will not play quite as easily with the wider opening. That being said, the difference in usability may be no more than 15 minutes of practice. It's made of high quality rip-stop Nylon (PA).
FLUXBAG FUN specs
Our FLUXBAG FUN provides you with 100 liters of air in one go (approx. 30% less than the PRO). You may have to re-flux more to fill the same inflatable. On the other hand, the FUN is easier to handle compared with the PRO since it is only 50cm wide and faster to fill with just one breath. It's made of high quality polyester fabric in the same specifications as the PRO's nylon.
For the Balloons United Edition we added 5 click-on adapter disks to a fully-fledged FLUXBAG PRO
Since the new generation FLUXBAGs come with built-in blow-back-protection, you can use them to inflate balloons of any size now. With our friends at Balloons United – perhaps the world's best and biggest online store for anything balloons – we made a special edition for all the looners among us.
Need any custom parts? 
We have covered all common kinds and sizes of valves in the leisure and outdoor segment. Yet there surely is that special-sized valve where none of the nozzles will fit (well). Also, you may come up with your own idea of what to do and connect with your FLUXBAG –something no one has ever thought of before.. 
To make the FLUXBAG useful even for these special cases, we will provide a 3D file download of the nozzle base as well as the connector thread from our website after the Kickstarter campaign is finished, so you can design and print yourself whatever nozzle, connector – or anything else – you may need.
A thankful note to the backers of our first Kickstarter campaign in 2016
Without you, there would be no FLUXBAG! We so much appreciate your support and trust at a time when we were admittedly quite clueless about what we were getting ourselves into. We had sent you a final backer update a few days ago where we shared some of our experiences from the last two years.
The final screen of our 2016 Kickstarter campaign that made all this possible
In this new campaign we created special rewards that we thought would fit your needs without having to rob the bank: You can just pledge for the new kit. Also, there are attractive limited packages of a new FLUXBAG with an additional kit that will upgrade your old 2016 Kickstarter Edition as well. If you got a multi-pack back then, you will be able to add more new kits for only a little more money when you check out your new reward in Backerkit. We hope that works for everybody!
Looking back: A round trip via German "Shark Tank" – and even Amazon
This all started in early summer 2016 when we came up with the idea and made the first prototypes from polyethylene (PE) tube foil. 
June 2016: Demoing the first prototypes. For some reasons we wanted to lie on the thing back then, LOL
Only a few weeks later, we successfully introduced the FLUXBAG on Kickstarter. We went to China, had the first batch made, and properly shipped these pre-orders in Winter 2017. 
December 2016: Lucas at our first manufacturer in Dongguan
Shortly after that, we found ourselves on the official German version of "Shark Tank" ("Die Höhle der Löwen", literally "The Lions' Den" on German VOX) where we cut a deal with Ralf Dümmel. In the end we decided not to give away any company shares and just licensed the product to our "shark's" company in order to pocket some money from the TV show. Ralf's company made and sold tens of thousands of their licensed FLUXBAGs that used a cheaper and much heavier fabric than we did. To our knowledge, it is therefore already the world's best-selling pump sack.  
March 2017: Filming DHDL/German "Shark Tank" with products from our first Kickstarter campaign
Last summer our own original FLUXBAGs that we had manufactured a year earlier became a bestseller on German Amazon. The product consistently ranked among the top 5 manual air pumps in Amazon.de's "Sports & Outdoor" department.
But frankly, 3.7 stars from reviews on Amazon is below what we set out to achieve. All design and manufacturing happened extremely fast and within a period of just a few months - our 1st and 2nd generation products were very similar and definitely had a few kinks. This revolutionary idea deserves better - and we will deliver!
We listened very carefully to the customer feedback we got, and went back to the drawing board. Now we have completely redesigned and greatly improved everything molded & plastic that came with the Generation 1.0 and 2.0 products and added new nozzles, adapters and an accessory. It may not sound like much, but it makes the FLUXBAG something that is REALLY helpful, practical, and honest.
We are HILFE Industries
Left: Jens –––– Right: Lucas (takes time off)
We founded HILFE Industries in 2016 as a product generator startup in Leipzig, Germany and Hong Kong. For the new generation FLUXBAGs we are working with Henning Seide, a Leipzig-based product designer specialising in 3D for plastic moulding.
Fulfillment & Shipping
We are using Backerkit again to streamline the process for everyone. Backerkit helps keep track of your shipping address even if you are moving. It will also let you add more items to your Kickstarter pledge. 
Your rewards will be shipped with a tracking ID directly from Hong Kong at very favourable international rates.
The FLUXBAG is "customs friendly" - we have not heard from anyone in our first Kickstarter whose shipment was held by customs in order to charge additional fees or taxes. We will pull some strings again to make sure you receive your reward as smoothly.
Photo Credits: Team FLUXBAG at the DHDL TV studio: VOX / Bernd-Michael Maurer /// Team FLUXBAG portrait at the beach: Anne Schwerin /// Some in-situ photo: Jessica Zaydan /// Product studio shots: Sophia Kesting, Franziska Krepp
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
You may consider this a low-risk Kickstarter project for various reasons:

(1) This is a 3rd generation product, we have been doing this for a good two years already. Thousands of customers have used earlier versions, we got a lot of feedback and have worked out kinks in earlier versions.

(2) The textile "bag parts" have been already manufactured and are of outstanding quality. Our QA rejection rate there is significantly below 0.5%.

(3) For the new components, we continue working with our established network of suppliers in China. We know them all, have visited the factories and built mutual trust. Still, we have contracts of course and will employ third-party quality assurance services as we did before. We will be in China when your rewards are assembled and packaged to ensure professional quality standards.

(4) We are a real company established in 2016, not just a couple of guys with a cool idea. To us, Kickstarter is an extremely important platform to introduce future products - so we won't ruin our standing here. Expect something literally bright later this year from HILFE Industries here on KS.

Even so, there are residual risks: If Jens as the project's leader dies in a plane crash, the project is in serious trouble. If our plastic molder's factory in Guangzhou or our fulfillment center in Hong Kong burns down, there will be delays. But frankly, we suggest you trust this. Thanks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
Things are coming together bit by bit. After being held up by a jam in customs for almost a week, the second iteration of the new parts (i.e. T2) has arrived yesterday. We made them in three different hardnesses so the snap joint connection between the nozzles and the adapter is firm enough to hold when you put pressure on the FLUXBAG – but lose enough to be disassembled without super-human powers in your hands. Also, the connection with those very special, unstandardised Decathlon flat valves was another hardness issue that is now solved.

Four weeks after my last update the three new molds have been milled. The first T1 iteration of all the new parts has been finished in Shenzhen last Friday and arrived here earlier today. That’s one of the good things about living in Leipzig: You have the huge European DHL hub at LEJ airport and Express shipments are even faster.

updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
Even though I said before that I will only update when there’s relevant news, I should not have let so much time passed since my last update. Sorry for that!
Anyway: Yesterday I eventually ordered the new molds for the new parts, yay!

Hello Backers,
Following my policy to publish updates when there is any news to report, here we go..
Remember: In July I informed you that everything is still alive and kicking again despite the old legal entity’s insolvency filing and my health problems. I was planning to make a new set of plastic nozzles and other parts in China.

Hello Backers,
Finally, things are moving again. Really now. Sorry, for not updating you earlier – but what sense would it have made as long as everything was still in limbo?
Remember: Company insolvency, solo entrepreneur with severe burnout, no money at all... It really took me a while to really (!) recover, and even longer to come up with an elegant solution for new money – but finally, we have arrived there. It’s so much fun to work again and see things progressing!

Magnic Microlights in Action
If your web connection is slow, watch the video with additional Eddy Current Explanation + Smart Feature Demonstration with automatic subtitles in 8 languages:
1. WHY MAGNIC MICROLIGHTS & WEGA ARE GAME CHANGERS
Cyclists can't escape darkness: It returns every evening and sometimes even at daytime when passing tunnels. Battery lights seem comfortable with quick & easy installation but there will be moments when the batteries are empty while you need them most.
With Magnic Microlights you don't have to fear these moments because you have neverending light :

Benefits of Magnic Microlights:
Non Contact : You don't feel or hear them
No batteries - Neverending power
Strong enough to enlight the road ahead
Easy To Install 
Cool "invisible" design: Compact size without adapters
Environmentally Friendly
Works with all bicycle models - WEGA for disc brakes
Don't fear the dark! The best time to cycle is whenever you want.
Magnic Microlights are the world’s smallest non-contact dynamos, that are integrated together with electronics and lighting system in the brake shoes. In 2012 we presented our invention Magnic Light here on Kickstarter. Many "experts" did not believe this principle can work and believed our lights would be a fake but the MAGIC is clever usage of well known eddy current technology. With more than 17.000 Magnic lights on the road via our successful Magnic Light IC campaign 2014 and our webshop we have proved that this sustainable, environment-friendly technology has the power to replace battery lights for bicycles. 
The last 18 months we worked hard on the development of the Micro-Technology. With Magnic Microlights you can add non-contact dynamo light to your bicycle without need of extra adapters. If your bicycle has disc brakes choose Wega which has flexibility in four directions and fits to nearly all other bikes (except Vbrake/Canti systems), too.  
3D Printed material, Fully functional contactless generator & PCB Board electronic.
MAGNIC MICROLIGHT compared to WEGA- THE MICROLIGHT for disc brakes. We named it WEGA because of the similarity with the stellar constellation Lyra and it's brightest star Wega
WEGA might be the most universal bike light on planet earth
HOW CAN THESE TINY LIGHTS BE STRONG?
Beneath generator technology one important aspect is the optimal choice of LED + lens which gives a big advantage compared to normal LED bicycle lights. For the Magnic Microlights we have chosen the newest extreme density - Cree LED (available since summer 2018): The most efficient high power LED with minimum size (1.6 mm x 1.6mm compared to 3.45mm x 3.45mm as used in many LED biycle lights).

What does this mean for Magnic Microlights?

Imagine you have a good bicycle light with 3,45mm x 3,45 mm LED, Lens of size 34,5 mm and 100 Lumen/Watt (These are quite excellent values for biycle lights).  
Magnic Microlights don't have the strongest generators (because cyclists should not feel anything!) but they have the best light efficiency on the market: 200 Lumen/Watt !
With same current and tiny lenses MAGNIC MICROLIGHTS & WEGA have twice the power of large high quality LED/lens applications.
2. WHICH REWARD FITS YOUR BIKE?
See the specification here and preorder on the top right of this page.
MAGNIC LIGHT TEAM CLOTHING
See pictures in the gallery
3. LET ANIMATIONS EXPLAIN FUNCTIONS 
We have tested the current brakeshoe design from May to October on roadbikes & mountainbikes with more than 3000 test kilometers. Although the stability of the prototype material (3d printed PLA) did not match that of the final product, there was no  difference in braking performance compared to standard brakes that we otherwise use in training and everyday cycling.
See more details in the gallery...
TECHNICAL DATA

Our prototypes are less efficient than the final version because of lower generator power. We have to estimate the power of the final product based on the prototypes and our experience from the current Magnic Light version.

BRAKE LIGHT
Magnic Microlights have an effective brake light function. When you pull the brakes the distance between rim and generator decreases resulting in higher generator power and higher light output. The brake light works precisely and is a clear signal for subsequent traffic.
All Magnic Microlights have an integrated "Brake Light"-function shown here: When you pull the brakes the lights brighten up which warns the driver behind you.
BEAM ADJUSTMENT
The design of front-& rearlight allows to adjust the light beam regardless of the fork angle. Even for extreme bicycle frame geometry you can adjust the light beam towards the road.
BRAKE RUBBER REPLACEMENT
Worn brake pads can be exchanged easily as you would expect from standard brakes. 
SHIFT MECHANISM
After longer usage your brakepads will loose up to 5mm material before you have to exchange them. The generator performance stongly depends on the rim distance so we have integrated an automatic shift mechanism to keep the distance between generator and rim constant small. An exchangeable shift-element moves the generator away from the rim and prevents grinding of the generator part.
After longer usage your brakepads will loose up to 5mm material before you have to exchange them. We have integrated an automatic shift mechanism to keep the distance between generator and rim constant which is important for performance of the system.
WEGA VISIBILITY

Wega is visible from both sides
See more details in the gallery...
                                                                                                                         4. HOW CAN YOUR BIKE GLOW AT NIGHT?
When we tried to assemble the "perfect" bicycle for this technology we were fascinated by the combination with phosphorescent wheels and decided to offer the Magnic Night Bike as reward, too.
Here you see the "Glow ion the dark" effect of the Magnic Night Bike wheels.
 These are custom made wheels. In addition to the phosphorescent painting these are high quality welded aluminium rims which you only find on upper class roadbikes (like Shimano or Mavic). Even if "normal" rims work good with all Magnic Lights these rims are welded and don't have a magnetic rim joint. 
 

PREMIUM
The Magnic Night Bike is unique! You won't find something like this in any bike shop! Click on the image to reach the gallery.
   See more details in the gallery...
Four Magnic Microlights enlight the welded “Glow in the dark" rims. To keep your trousers clean when cycling we have replaced the standard chain by a Carbon belt drive from the leading company for bicycle belt drives : Gates. Magnic Microlights need no cables so this bike follows the no-cables concept (except brake cables) but allows to shift between low and high speed gear with the automatic Sturmey Archer hub.
CLASSIC
The CLASSIC version comes with a standard chain. You can turn the rear while and either us as free-wheel single speed bike or as FIXE with rigid hub.
See more details in the gallery...
6. FASCINATING TECHNOLOGY & PHYSICS
The main technology of our lights is based on eddy current induction.
  PLAY

The core part is the world’s smallest contact- and frictionless bicycle dynamo, that is integrated together with the electronic and the lighting system in the brake shoe of a calliper brake. The world-wide patented technic developed by the German company Magnic Innovations is based on  eddy current induction: a magnetic wheel in a generator separated from the bicycle rim by a narrow air gap induces temporary magnetic fields even in non-magnetic aluminium bicycle rims when the bicycle rim is moving. This leads to the magnetic wheel rotating contactlessly as if by magic.
Neither batteries nor external cables, further fittings or spoke-magnets are necessary. Only the brake shoes have to be exchanged for microlight - brake shoes, so that the maintenance only involves the exchange of worn brake pads after thousands of kilometres. The included brake pads are compatible with other standard brake pads of other manufacturers as available in every cycle shop.
Eddy current
Eddy currents (I, red) induced in a conductive metal plate (C) as it moves to right under a magnet (N)
The key is so-called eddy current technology : Energy is drawn from the rotating bicycle wheels without any physical contact, and thus without friction. Instead, eddy currents, created by strong magnets, generate electricity to power the lights: When the wheel spins, magnets inside the generator induce eddy currents with corresponding magnetic fields in the wheel, which in turn interact with the magnets in the generator. The resulting electricity will power your lights indefinitely without any environmentally harmful batteries or cumbersome cables.
While the previous larger Magnic Lights were equipped with two LEDs (one for stand light) Magnic Microlights have just one LED which is fed by ultra-high efficient Mosfet rectifiers.
7. HOW THE FUTURE CAN BE SMART
The SMART VERSION presented here can only be realized within the rangeof this project if we reach a very high stretch goal of 500.000 €. We don't expect to reach this goal but present what is possible if we do. (In case this amount is reached the reward for the SMART VERSION will be available in the rewards section and you can switch if you like).   
Reason for the high stretch goal: High cost for final development of bluetooth control software & electronics. At the moment we have implemented the main features with prototypes based on the electronic boards and microprocessors of the larger MAGNIC LIGHT IC version.
Turn Signals  
The Smart version comes with a cool novelty : A blink system for turn signals without any additional switches and even without a smartphone. How does it work? If you tap the brake lever the distance between Microlights and rim changes which can be detected in the lights (even without braking). A double-tap is our signal for the blinker: If you double-tap the right brake lever the rear lights detect the signal and via bluetooth to the front lights- so that lights on the right side are blinking. Correspondingly this works on the left side.  
Navigation  
Navigation is similar to the turn signals - but here you are guided and need our Smartphone App for navigation: Lights are controlled by the navigation app and start to blink on the left or right side when you have to turn left/right. Put your smartphone in your bag and let the lights guide your way.  
Speed Data Transmission  
The smart Magnic Microlights are equipped with a Bluetooth LE microcontroller which easily detects the rotation speed of your wheel from the incoming current. Via smartphone or Bluetooth LE compatible speedometer you can receive speed data for display or further processing. This feature replaces Bluetooth LE speed sensors which have the same function but need extra mounting and extra batteries.  
Crash detection with emergency call  
This feature requires some future development and is still theory. In case of a crash generators will stop abruptly. We need some test data but we are confident to be able to detect a crash situation reliably which can be sent to the smartphone in order to make an emergency call.  
Configuraton for Stand light and more  
We will offer different stand light patterns which can be set via Smartphone App. Additionally it will be possible to switch the internal orientation of the lights (for example for correct turn signals if your left and right brake levers deviate from standard installations).
8. HOW WE DO POLITICS: GERMAN STVZO   
Nov. 5th 2018, UPDATE
Concering German STVZO approval for our new lighting technology some frustrating years are behind us. But we did not give up and we achieved that the highest responsable committees were invloved in new rules for STVZO approval concerning our technology. Today we were informed that our main ideas could influence the new legislation which shall pass the Verkehrsauschuss (Committee of Transport) of the German Bundestag next month. We believe that the German rules are too complex and old fashioned and hopefully our efforts help to go in the right direction. For our systems (Magnic Light IC, and Magnic Microlights) this is good news because we finally can adjust our lights concerning to these rules.
For our technology here are the three most important new rules concerning Magnic Light:  
For lighting systems consisting of two separate lights (left & right) the total amount of light needs to exceed the minimum of 10 lux (and not each single light). (Otherwise our lights should have been twice as bright as the required minimum value at 15km/h while they easily do at >25 km/h) 
For lens systems the "brightest area" can replace brightest point of the light distribution (which is the measurement point for the light distribution with respect to "anti-blinding" characteristics). The highest point within such an the "brightest area" can be taken as measurement point now which previously gave room for ambiguity. - 
The German bicycle light lobby wanted to have a new rule that prohibits dynamos with less than 50% efficiency. Sounds reasonable but measurements for "Micro"-system are very complex (and expensive) because the result can be distorted by air resistance, wheel material, bearings, .. much more than these parameters influence large systems (hub dynamos). We could not stop this new rule but at least we could achieve that is is not necessary to prove efficiency charateristics for micro-dynamos below 1,3 Watts. (Background: The rule shall prevent cyclists from exerting too much effort for their dynamo lights- Consequently we should forbid non-aerodynamic clothin for cyclists in future because this costs much more energy ;.) I want to address this to the German Minister for Environment, Svenja Schulze at the Awards Ceromony for the Bundespreis Ecodesign on Nov. 26th in Berlin.
For a "detailed analysis" of the effort you have to pay for Magnic Microlights see the this video below:

Cycling is an important part of our live- not just as a business. Below you see images from "The Making of" video & photo material for this project. Whenever we are cycling Magnic Lights & Magnic Microlights are with us (Cycling to Calais, in Berlin, on straw bales ...)
